description: The Government of Liberia has declared a state of national health emergency.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: "On March 22, the Liberian Ministry of Health released a Declaration of National Health Emergency." The Declaration announces school closures and restrictions on public gatherings in Monteserrado and Margibi counties, as well as the closure of Roberts International Airport (with limited exceptions).

Liberia's President George Weah announced that he intends to declare a state of emergency starting at 23:59 (local time) on Friday, April 10, due to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. President Weah has called for an emergency session of parliament so that MPs can approve the measure. The emergency law would last for three weeks and is renewable. Throughout this period, residents may only leave home for essential journeys such as food shopping and for medical purposes, which should be restricted to local communities and be limited to a single person per household for a maximum of one hour.

Liberia's President George Weah announces that he intends to declare a state of emergency starting at 23:59 (local time) on Friday, April 10, due to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. President Weah has called for an emergency session of parliament so that MPs can approve the measure. The emergency law would last for three weeks and is renewable. Throughout this period, residents may only leave home for essential journeys such as food shopping and for medical purposes, which should be restricted to local communities and be limited to a single person per household for a maximum of one hour.

President George Weah announced that Liberia's stay-at-home measures in place to prevent the spread of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) will be extended by a further two weeks through until Friday, May 8. The measures have been in place since Saturday, April 11, and will now include the compulsory wearing of face masks in public. Among other restrictions remaining in effect is a daily curfew at 15:00 (local time), a ban on movement between counties, and the closure of all non-essential businesses.

Liberia's President George Weah announced that he intends to declare a state of emergency starting at 23:59 (local time) on Friday, April 10, due to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. President Weah has called for an emergency session of parliament so that MPs can approve the measure. The emergency law would last for three weeks and is renewable. Throughout this period, residents may only leave home for essential journeys such as food shopping and for medical purposes, which should be restricted to local communities and be limited to a single person per household for a maximum of one hour. UPDATE: The original quarantine was set to last until May 8th, has been extended to another 2 weeks, ending May 22nd

"On March 22, the Liberian Ministry of Health released a Declaration of National Health Emergency." The Declaration announces school closures and restrictions on public gatherings in Monteserrado and Margibi counties, as well as the closure of Roberts International Airport (with limited exceptions). On May 17th, Liberia is reopening its houses of worship. UPDATE: In Liberia, Mosques/Religious Worship Centers that were closed since March 22, have been reopened starting May 17th, 2020.

Liberia's President George Weah announced that he intends to declare a state of emergency starting at 23:59 (local time) on Friday, April 10, due to the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic. President Weah has called for an emergency session of parliament so that MPs can approve the measure. The emergency law would last for three weeks and is renewable. Throughout this period, residents may only leave home for essential journeys such as food shopping and for medical purposes, which should be restricted to local communities and be limited to a single person per household for a maximum of one hour. UPDATE: The original state of emergency set to end May 22nd, has been extended for another 2 weeks, ending on June 09, 2020.

description: Liberia ordered that "all passengers arriving at the country's airport be checked by a medical team, before border checks."

A state of emergency which is due to end next Tuesday will not be renewed.
